children.name: Business
Employment
Competence Vs Legacy: The Employer's Decision

data.Title: Competence Vs Legacy: The Employer's Decision
data.Notes: Not specifically focused on women- also presents biases due to race and perception of similarity; no recommendations presented
data.Goal: To understand the extent to which perceived similarity due to a shared alma mater, candidate quality, and gender can impact the hiring process
data.Stakeholders: Potential employers, people looking for jobs
data.Impact: Overall, when the candidate was good, male candidates were rated more favorably than females; when the candidate was very good, females were rated more favorably. Biases occurred due to race, gender, and perception of similarity
data.Headline: Gender and hiring decisions

children.name: Does Having A Foreign Accent Affect Men And Women Differently? Effect Of Foreign Accent And Gender On Employment Decisions And Negotiations

data.Title: Does Having A Foreign Accent Affect Men And Women Differently? Effect Of Foreign Accent And Gender On Employment Decisions And Negotiations
data.Goal: To examine the effect of international accents and gender on hiring and negotiation perceptions
data.Stakeholders: People looking for jobs, people with accents
data.Impact: Female candidates with a foreign accent are less likely to be hired than female candidates with an American accent
data.Headline: Accent and gender correlation to employment

children.name: Marketing
Empowering The Women’s Cooperative Of Ban Pang Ung Mhai Through The Competitive Marketing Of Crafts

data.Title: Empowering The Women’s Cooperative Of Ban Pang Ung Mhai Through The Competitive Marketing Of Crafts
data.Notes: Product portfolio included in the appendices- lots of photos of products
data.Goal: To empower the women’s cooperative in Ban Pang Ung Mhai by promoting skills for improving a marketing strategy in order to establish a more profitable craft business
data.Stakeholders: Raks Thai Foundation, women of the Cooperative and their families
data.Impact: If the women's marketing knowledge were increased, their business would be more successful (recommendations were made to help with this). Conservation and promotion of culture are important to maintain consumer attraction
data.Headline: Marketing women's crafts in Thailand

children.name: Exploring Value Adding Initiatives In Rural Northern Greece

data.Title: Exploring Value Adding Initiatives In Rural Northern Greece
data.Notes: A visually pleasing report, but the women's cooperative is just a subset of the report
data.Goal: To explore efforts to bring value to a rural region of northern Greece, (Nea Kallikratia and surrounding villages, in Halkidiki and Central Macedonia) with a particular focus on innovative tourism development initiatives
data.Stakeholders: Tourists, Greeks living in rural communities, Greeks in general due to the effect on the economy
data.Impact: Diversification principles and innovative marketing led to the most success
data.Headline: Expanding tourism in Northern Greece

children.name: Marketing Hand-milled Rice In Thailand: Creating A Self-sustainable Future For The Village Of Mae Khong Khaa

data.Title: Marketing Hand-milled Rice In Thailand: Creating A Self-sustainable Future For The Village Of Mae Khong Khaa
data.Advisors: Peet, R. Creighton| Pollice, Gary F.
data.Goal: The goal of this project was to provide the Raks Thai Foundation with a marketing plan for the Mae Khong Khaa rice, and to begin to educate the Mae Khong Khaa villagers on the importance of marketing so that they can gain a reliable and better income from the sale of their rice
data.Stakeholders: Villagers of Mae Khong Khaa
data.Impact: Developed a marketing plan, which included a current product profile, information on how to introduce the product to a specific market, and effective marketing mediums including a marketing brochure and logo
data.Headline: Marketing rice in a community in Thailand

children.name: Small Business, Big Impact: A Female-led Microbusiness In Ecuador

data.Title: Small Business, Big Impact: A Female-led Microbusiness In Ecuador
data.Notes: https://miramecuenca.wordpress.com/
data.Goal: To aid the Hearts of Gold Foundation in laying the groundwork for the establishment of a female led business in Cuenca, Ecuador
data.Stakeholders: Women in the Azuay province, Hearts of Gold Foundation
data.Impact:
Found that jewelry was the optimal choice for a product, 
social enterprise marketing is the best way to market the jewelry to the U.S. and Canada, new business should be established as a compañía limitada (limited liability company), and the startup cost for the new business would be around $144,400- the best way to source initial capital would be to start a crowdfunding campaign
data.Headline: Supporting marginalized women to start local businesses

children.name: Uncorking Identity: Exploring Consumer-brand Identification Within The South African Wine Industry

data.Title: Uncorking Identity: Exploring Consumer-brand Identification Within The South African Wine Industry
data.Notes: Report has lots of visuals
data.Goal: To explore the issues of identity with regards to wine consumption in an effort to inform new producers, like our sponsor Women and Wine, how they might consider future brand imagery
data.Stakeholders: Underrepresented groups in wine making industry, Women in Wine
data.Impact: Found that four key drivers predict consumer-brand identification within the wine industry: brand prestige, brand social benefits, brand distinctiveness, and brand warmth
data.Headline: Exploring consumer-brand identification for the wine industry in South Africa

children.name: Exploring Market Opportunities For Women In Wine In The South African And Global Wine Industries

data.Title: Exploring Market Opportunities For Women In Wine In The South African And Global Wine Industries
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report
data.Goal: To help Women in Wine identify strategies for domestic and international expansion by assessing its’ products placement in the market, as influenced by the company’s progressive social and environmental sustainability mission
data.Stakeholders: Women in Wine
data.Impact: Found that taste and quality are the most important aspects of a wine according to consumers, retailers, and industry professionals
data.Headline: Expanding Women in Wine in South Africa

children.name: I Am Dress For Success Worcester: A Video Campaign

data.Title: I Am Dress For Success Worcester: A Video Campaign
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report
data.Goal: To create marketing materials to help Dress for Success Worcester promote their range of services
data.Stakeholders: Women seeking jobs in Worcester, Dress for Success Worcester
data.Impact: 6 videos developed- The Suiting Program, The Financial Literacy Program, The Workplace Readiness Program (I Am Successful Program), The Career Center Program, and The Professional Women’s Group
data.Headline: Promotion of Dress for Success Worcester

children.name: No Sub-Category
Plastic Waste Pollution And Mosquito Control In Bangkok Slums -- An Educational Approach

data.Title: Plastic Waste Pollution And Mosquito Control In Bangkok Slums -- An Educational Approach
data.Subject Terms: Recycling (waste, Etc.) | Plastics | Women In Development
data.Notes: Not much of an analysis on teaching the women's craft group how to weave with plastic bags, just the children's educational program
data.Goal: to help prevent plastic pollution by teaching women’s craft groups how to use plastics in weaving and spread awareness about plastic pollution to preschoolers
data.Stakeholders: Human Development Center (HDC), preschoolers and women’s craft groups in Bangkok
data.Impact: Createde a puppet show for preschoolers and a plastic weaving demonstration for craft groups
data.Headline: Weaving with plastic bags in women's craft groups, Bangkok

children.name: A Radical Feminist Critique Of The Video Game Industry

data.Title: A Radical Feminist Critique Of The Video Game Industry
data.Notes: More of a research paper- not really any recommendations given
data.Goal: To discuss the objectification of women in video games
data.Stakeholders: Video game industry, people who play video games
data.Impact: Reveals how societal values are reflected in the video game industry through the various tropes of female characters in video games (damsel in distress, "Ms. Male character," sexual objectification of females)
data.Headline: A Radical Feminist Critique of the Video Games Industry

children.name: The Mix Of Media And Decadence

data.Title: The Mix Of Media And Decadence
data.Notes: Research paper- no recommendations provided
data.Goal: Follows the history of burlesque, pinups, and striptease as it establishes her ascendance in advertising and third-wave feminism as a key element in public discourse
data.Impact: Follows the history of femme fatale in American pop culture
data.Headline: Burlesque, pinups, striptease, and feminism in public discourse

children.name: Technology
Internet Privacy: Public Perceptions Of Security And Convenience

data.Title: Internet Privacy: Public Perceptions Of Security And Convenience
data.Notes: Gender was just one component of the analysis
data.Goal: To determine how Internet users’ educational background, gender, and amount of time spent online affect their preference for privacy or convenience within the services of social networking, e-commerce, and online banking
data.Stakeholders: People who use the internet
data.Impact: Results included: non-WPI students ranked themselves higher in knowledge about internet privacy than WPI students, males believed they were more knowledgeable about internet privacy than females, males believed they were more knowledgeable than females about protecting themselves from online threats, more females valued privacy over convenience
data.Headline: Gender and internet privacy

children.name: Website Development For Association Solidarité Féminine

data.Title: Website Development For Association Solidarité Féminine
data.Subject Terms: Websites--design And Construction | Women In Development | Women--social Conditions
data.Advisors: Shockey, Ingrid K.| Somasse, Gbetonmasse B.
data.Notes: Lots of visuals in the report
data.Goal: To create a website for the Association Solidarité Féminine organization (ASF) by understanding the mission, outreach, the client base, and the constituents
data.Stakeholders: Association Solidarité Féminine
data.Impact: Developed a website template for the Association (located at https://solfem.wordpress.com/)
data.Headline: Website development for org supporting single moms

children.name: Women Weavers Of Ain Leuh, Morocco: Use Of Internet Technology & Global Marketing

data.Title: Women Weavers Of Ain Leuh, Morocco: Use Of Internet Technology & Global Marketing
data.Subject Terms: Women--effect Of Technological Innovations On | Equality | Community Development
data.Goal: To create a website for the women of the Cooperative des Tisseuses d’Ain Leuh, which is located in Ain Leuh, Morocco
data.Stakeholders: Cooperative des Tisseuses d’Ain Leuh
data.Impact: A website was constructed for The Cooperative des Tisseuses d’Ain Leuh
data.Headline: Website development for weavers in Morocco

children.name: Women's Environmental Network: Improving An Internet Presence

data.Title: Women's Environmental Network: Improving An Internet Presence
data.Subject Terms: Women | Interactive Multimedia | Websites--design And Construction
data.Advisors: Elmes, Michael B.| Higgins, Lorraine D.
data.Goal: To determine how to achieve the most effective internet presence and to educate the Women's Environmental Network on these findings
data.Stakeholders: Women's Environmental Network
data.Impact: Developed a Facebook page, prototype designs for an updated website, and recommendations for future maintenance and improvement
data.Headline: Website development for women's environmental org in England

children.name: Technology In Service Of The Poor: An Assessment Of A Unique Poverty Diagnostic Tool And Its Implementation In Paraguay

data.Title: Technology In Service Of The Poor: An Assessment Of A Unique Poverty Diagnostic Tool And Its Implementation In Paraguay
data.Subject Terms: Women--economic Aspects | Women Entrepreneurs | Women In Development
data.Goal: To improve the monitoring system in place for tracking income poverty in the Poverty Stoplight Program developed by Fundacion Paraguaya
data.Stakeholders: Fundación Paraguaya, people benefitting from the Poverty Stoplight Program
data.Impact: Provided recommendations to improve the Poverty Stoplight Program from a management perspective
data.Headline: Women and the Poverty Stoplight Program - Paraguay

children.name: Cultural
No Sub-Category
Worcester Women's Oral History Project

data.Title: Worcester Women's Oral History Project
data.Goal: To investigate the feasibility of creating a permanent site of women’s oral history at the new Worcester Visitor Center
data.Stakeholders: Worcester Visitor Center, Worcester community
data.Impact: Designed a directory and offered recommendations to enable a feasible implementation of the site; designed a database to store oral interviews
data.Headline: Worcester women's oral history project

children.name: Insurance Versus Gambling -- How Context Affects Risk-taking Behavior.

data.Title: Insurance Versus Gambling -- How Context Affects Risk-taking Behavior.
data.Notes: Gender is a significant predictor of risk taking
data.Goal: To determine if context of gambling versus insurance is one of the major determining factors in risky decision making
data.Stakeholders: People who take risks
data.Impact: Females appeared to be more risk-averse than males
data.Headline: Gender as a predictor of risk taking

children.name: Art Culture And Fractal Dimension

data.Title: Art Culture And Fractal Dimension
data.Notes: explores difference between male and female painters; only one aspect of report
data.Goal: To explore the relationships between fractal dimension and aesthetic painting analysis
data.Impact: Fractal dimension of these paintings is correlated closely with the artist career and the prevailing culture
data.Headline: Gender differences in art culture and fractal dimension

children.name: The Xhubleta: A Woman's Perspective

data.Title: The Xhubleta: A Woman's Perspective
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report
data.Goal: To understand and document the changing experience of women in northern Albania over the past century, using a traditional costume, the xhubleta, as a lens to see into their lives
data.Stakeholders: GO2 Albania, women in Albania
data.Impact:
Found contradictions surrounding the various cultural meanings assigned to the dress, with women’s subjugation under patriarchal customs co-existing with women’s pride in wearing it;
the dress is seen as an object, unattached to the lives of the wearers., which is very different from the ways the xhubleta was seen in the past
data.Headline: Women's perspective on Albanian traditional dress

children.name: College Perceptions Of Instant Messaging -- A Technology Fluxus

data.Title: College Perceptions Of Instant Messaging -- A Technology Fluxus
data.Notes: Interview transcripts had mentions of how women tend to get more offended than men if a miscommunication arises, but there was no mention of women otherwise
data.Goal: To capture and share college-age students’ perceptions of instant messaging
data.Stakeholders: College students, people who use IM
data.Impact: Common themes from interviews were personal IM history, benefits of IM, relationships, and communication

children.name: The Effect Of An Educational Video On The Acceptance Of Nanotechnology

data.Title: The Effect Of An Educational Video On The Acceptance Of Nanotechnology
data.Notes: More focused on overall results, but examined them based on gender as well; lots of figures in the report
data.Goal: To examine the effect of education about nanotechnology on acceptance
data.Stakeholders: People who develop/use nanotechnology (focusing on college students)
data.Impact: Found that girls consider mathematics more difficult and have a much more negative opinion of the subject

children.name: Education
Gender Equity
Aspirations Of Young Women In Worcester's Private Schools.

data.Title: Aspirations Of Young Women In Worcester's Private Schools.
data.Goal: To determine if the next generation of Worcester was moving towards gender equity
data.Stakeholders: Worcester City Manager, Worcester students
data.Impact: Not many differences between career aspirations of students in private/charter schools when compared with public schools overall; more females in public schools aspiring to careers in business, medical practice, and law, which are typically male-dominated; more students in private/charter schools interested in college than students in public schools; no correlation between ethnicity and future plans in private/charter schools; more ethnic students had career reservations because people of their gender either did not go into that field or they thought college was too difficult; Catholic schools were far more gender stereotypical in all but two areas
data.Headline: Studying gendered career interests in Worcester private schools

children.name: Career Aspirations And Gender Identity In Coed And Single Sex High Schools

data.Title: Career Aspirations And Gender Identity In Coed And Single Sex High Schools
data.Notes: Interesting conclusion- says that masculine females will be the ones paving the way towards gender equity
data.Goal: To determine how gender mix in a school affects the aspirations and self image of the students in roughly comparable private parochial high schools
data.Stakeholders: Worcester parochial school students
data.Impact: Draws the conclusion that masculine-females will pave the way toward gender equity
data.Headline: Stuyding gendered career interests in Worcester schools
data.Follow-up: Follow up study would be ideal

children.name: Comparative Aspirations Study On Worcester Secondary Schools

data.Title: Comparative Aspirations Study On Worcester Secondary Schools
data.Goal: To determine if females were as likely to aspire to the same profession as males; to determine if females were considering the same range of possibilities as males; to determine if females were considering promising job prospects at the moment
data.Stakeholders: Advisory Council on the Status of Women, Worcester high school students
data.Impact: Showed differences in career aspirations in public versus private schools
data.Headline: Studying gendered career interests in Worcester secondary schools

children.name: Gender-based Comparative Survey Of Public Hs Students.

data.Title: Gender-based Comparative Survey Of Public Hs Students.
data.Notes: Results analyzed by gender and ethnicity
data.Goal: Gather and organize information on the aspirations of the students in Worcester Public High Schools class of 2006
data.Stakeholders: Worcester high school students, Worcester City Manager’s Committee on the Status of Women
data.Impact: Content words- females higher in categories of friend, female, sexual, archive, and reward; males higher in clout and words per second
data.Headline: Studying gendered career interests in Worcester schools

children.name: The Aspirations Of Young Women In Worcester Private/charter High Schools Replication Study

data.Title: The Aspirations Of Young Women In Worcester Private/charter High Schools Replication Study
data.Subject Terms: Women In Engineering | Women In Science
data.Goal: To determine what impact the sex ratio at four different parochial high schools ranging from all male to all female students was on career aspirations
data.Stakeholders: Worcester private/parochial high school students
data.Impact: Results replicated from the original private/charter school career aspirations study (Original 2005 study: https://docs.google.com/document/d/15e8kiUtgGNFnx-hJ44taTO1sZuSg4q-tbgfjub_VN0I/edit?usp=sharing)
data.Headline: Studying gendered career interests in Worcester private schools

children.name: Worcester Hs Career Aspiration Replication Study

data.Title: Worcester Hs Career Aspiration Replication Study
data.Goal: To determine the career interests of juniors was performed in the Worcester Public High Schools for the Advisory Committee on the Status of Women- the primary goal was to determine if the results replicated the previous year's findings
data.Stakeholders: Worcester high school students, the Advisory Committee on the Status of Women
data.Impact: The same approximate gender ratios of students by career interests, post-graduation plans, and career concerns were found to repeat from previous studies
data.Headline: Studying gendered career interests in Worcester schools

children.name: Middle School Aspirations Study

data.Title: Middle School Aspirations Study
data.Goal: To determine when gender differences take place in career aspirations by administering an aspirations survey to 8th graders
data.Stakeholders: Worcester public schools, Worcester middle school students
data.Impact: There were no gendered interests in the 8th grade sample
data.Headline: Studying gendered career interests in middle schools
data.Follow-up: A follow up study would be interesting to try and determine when gendered interests appear in students

children.name: North High School: Gender Equity Study

data.Title: North High School: Gender Equity Study
data.Goal: To explore whether exposing students to different areas of science would influence their attitudes towards the different areas of science
data.Stakeholders: North High School students
data.Impact: Students initially preferred biology over chemistry and physics, but after 14 weeks of going to the club, they liked all subjects equally. No gender differences found in preferences towards science, and ttitudes towards physical science improved equally
data.Headline: Changing gendered attitudes towards science

children.name: No Sub-Category
Wps Class Of 1999 Pilot Study For Wsc Follow-up

data.Title: Wps Class Of 1999 Pilot Study For Wsc Follow-up
data.Notes: Gender was just one component of the analysis
data.Goal: To develop a procedure to compare cognitive type, grades, SAT scores, and college placement
data.Stakeholders: Students at Worcester Public Schools, Worcester State College
data.Impact: The common personality type of minorities predicted they would do worse on the SATs
data.Headline: Gender components in standardized tests

children.name: We Don’t Agree, But We’re Working Together: Examining How Affiliative Motivation And Perspective Taking Effect Social Tuning

data.Title: We Don’t Agree, But We’re Working Together: Examining How Affiliative Motivation And Perspective Taking Effect Social Tuning
data.Goal: To examine the factors that cause students to behave more similar to members of their group or team
data.Stakeholders: People who work in groups
data.Impact: Participants expressed more gender traditional attitudes when having an interpersonal motivation
data.Headline: Behavior in groups

children.name: Stem
Camp Reach Alumni Workshop Development.

data.Title: Camp Reach Alumni Workshop Development.
data.Subject Terms: Education, Secondary | Engineering--study And Teaching | Women--education--science
data.Goal: To design a day long workshop for the Camp REACH alumni who are rising ninth graders in order to keep their interest in engineering, math, and science between when they participate in Camp REACH and when they start college
data.Stakeholders: Ninth grade females who are Camp REACH alumni; WPI
data.Impact: Developed and tested a series of workshops for WPI Camp REACH alumni- helps retain interest in STEM
data.Headline: Improving Camp REACH stem ed for girls

children.name: Development Of A Workshop For Camp Reach Alumni.

data.Title: Development Of A Workshop For Camp Reach Alumni.

data.Goal: To reinforce interest in science and engineering for Camp REACH alumni
data.Stakeholders: Camp REACH alumni, WPI
data.Impact: Developed an egg drop activity and a physics demonstration for Camp REACH alumni
data.Headline: Improving Camp REACH stem ed for girls

children.name: Evaluation Of Camp Reach.

data.Title: Evaluation Of Camp Reach.
data.Subject Terms: Engineering--study And Teaching| Women In Engineering
data.Goal: To design a Camp REACH alumni reunion and test run possible activities
data.Stakeholders: Alumni from Camp REACH, WPI
data.Impact: Developed an egg drop activity and a physics demonstration for Camp REACH alumni
data.Headline: Improving Camp REACH stem ed for girls

children.name: Improvement Of Workshop Component Of Camp Reach.

data.Title: Improvement Of Workshop Component Of Camp Reach.
data.Goal: To improve the workshop component at Camp REACH
data.Stakeholders: Girls at Camp REACH, WPI
data.Impact: Emphasized the need for more interaction and less discussion for the girls
data.Headline: Improving Camp REACH stem ed for girls

children.name: Redesigning And Expanding Wpi’s Summer Stem Programs For Middle School Girls

data.Title: Redesigning And Expanding Wpi’s Summer Stem Programs For Middle School Girls
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report
data.Goal: To design STEM activity guidelines for a set of summer programs, which include rising 6th, 7th, and 8th grade girls
data.Stakeholders: Girls in WPI’s summer STEM programs, WPI
data.Impact: Developed 25 modules for use when developing activities for future Camp Reach programs
data.Headline: Improving Camp REACH stem ed for girls

children.name: Design Of A Robotics Workshop For Camp Reach

data.Title: Design Of A Robotics Workshop For Camp Reach
data.Goal: To create an effective, affordable workshop for Camp REACH, a girls' summer camp held annually at Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI), that will be both educational and enjoyable for the campers
data.Stakeholders: Girls attending Camp REACH, WPI
data.Impact: Developed and tested a workshop for Camp REACH on Camp REACH alumni
data.Headline: Improving Camp REACH stem ed for girls

children.name: Design Of A Workshop For Camp Reach.

data.Title: Design Of A Workshop For Camp Reach.
data.Goal: Through the development of a workshop, attract girls to engineering and show them the importance of engineering- as well as boost their confidence
data.Stakeholders: Girls attending Camp REACH, Camp REACH
data.Impact: Girls were introduced to new topics and gained interest in engineering
data.Headline: Improving Camp REACH stem ed for girls

children.name: North High School -- Science And Technology Club.

data.Title: North High School -- Science And Technology Club.
data.Subject Terms: Science--study And Teaching|engineering--study And Teaching|mathematics--study And Teaching
data.Goal: To encourage students to take an interest in science and technology and consider this as a career option
data.Stakeholders: Students, esp. female students pursuing STEM
data.Impact: Had a diverse club in terms of race, gender, and career interests
data.Headline: Encouraging girls to pursue STEM through clubs

children.name: A Future Scientists And Engineers Club For Worcester South High School

data.Title: A Future Scientists And Engineers Club For Worcester South High School
data.Subject Terms: Engineering--study And Teaching |science--study And Teaching | Women In Engineering
data.Goal: Create a place where South High School students tentatively interested in science or technology as a college major could find out what engineering and science at the college level is about
data.Stakeholders: Students at Worcester South High School, Worcester City Manager’s Advisory Committee on the Status of Women (ACSW)
data.Impact: Answered questions about college admittance and about science/engineering in college. By the time the program was finished, the ratio was 1:2 females to males (the number of females increased weekly)- successfully increased female involvement
data.Headline: Encouraging girls to pursue STEM through clubs

children.name: Marketing Pre-engineering Diversity -- A Focus On Engineering Minorities

data.Title: Marketing Pre-engineering Diversity -- A Focus On Engineering Minorities
data.Advisors: Doyle, James K. | Camesano, Terri A.
data.Goal: To formulate effective recommendations to Doherty High School on how they can obtain a larger female and minority population in the pre-engineering program offered at their school
data.Stakeholders: Students at Doherty High School, students at Forest Grove Middle school
data.Impact: College surveys showed that the top two factors influencing females’ college choices are parents and teachers
data.Headline: Attracting girls to high school STEM

children.name: Improving Recruiting And Retention -- A Study Of Middle School Students Entering Technology/engineering Programs

data.Title: Improving Recruiting And Retention -- A Study Of Middle School Students Entering Technology/engineering Programs
data.Subject Terms: Engineering--study And Teaching | Women Engineers--education | Mathematics--study And Teaching
data.Advisors: McNeill, John A. | Loiacono, Eleanor T.
data.Goal: To determine the influences on the recruiting and retention of middle school students into technology and engineering programs
data.Stakeholders: Students at Forest Grove Middle School
data.Impact: Found that girls consider mathematics more difficult and have a much more negative opinion of the subject
data.Headline: Recruiting middle school girls to STEM

children.name: 3rd Grade Engineering And Technology Curriculum

data.Title: 3rd Grade Engineering And Technology Curriculum
data.Notes: Lesson plans in appendices; doesn't really talk about females
data.Goal: To develop lessons for engineering, work with the teachers to implement the lessons and evaluate the impact of the lessons
data.Stakeholders: Worcester public school students
data.Impact: Developed engineering curriculum that the students enjoyed
data.Headline: 3rd grade engineering and tech curriculum

children.name: Exploring Optics

data.Title: Exploring Optics
data.Goal: To design a complete course that is aimed at introducing optics to high school students, to give them knowledge about optics
data.Stakeholders: Girls Inc., summer school students
data.Impact: Developed physics course for high school girls who may show an interest in optics
data.Headline: Introducing girls to optics

children.name: Establishing A Technical University For Women.

data.Title: Establishing A Technical University For Women.
data.Notes: More of a research paper- presents a model of the institution, no recommendations; written because the author believed an all-female institution would encourage more female participation in engineering
data.Goal: To develop a non-coeducational technical university in Southern New Hampshire that will be about the same size as Caltech
data.Stakeholders: No real-world stakeholders; however, the development of this idea could influence females pursuing STEM-related fields
data.Impact: This was more of a research paper focused on developing a model institution. The author wrote this paper because they believed an all-female institution would encourage more female participation in science and engineering.
data.Headline: Developing plans for a female technical university

children.name: Improving Enrollment Of Female Engineers At Ntb

data.Title: Improving Enrollment Of Female Engineers At Ntb
data.Advisors: Jiusto, J. S.| Smith, Ruth L.
data.Goal: To improve the participation of women in the NTB Systems Engineering program
data.Stakeholders: Neues Technikum Buchs (NTB)
data.Impact:
Found that mentoring and shadowing programs would expose female students to the school
, programs designed with women in mind would help recruit more women to NTB, educating parents and teachers could be included in outreach programs, Girls’ Day would benefit from better marketing
data.Headline: Attracting women to systems engineering

children.name: Stem Program For The Boys & Girls Club Of Worcester

data.Title: Stem Program For The Boys & Girls Club Of Worcester
data.Subject Terms: Science--study And Teaching | Engineering--study And Teaching
data.Goal: Develop and prototype an engaging educational program, which would allow the Boys & Girls Club of Worcester to effectively and consistently introduce its 10-13 year old members to STEM
data.Stakeholders: Boys & Girls Club of Worcester (BGCW), boys and girls at BGCW
data.Impact: Parental, cultural, religious influences may dictate not only the interest level of the student regarding STEM, but also children’s ability to foresee themselves in specific STEM careers
data.Headline: STEM ed for the Boys & Girls Club of Worcester

children.name: Boys And Girls Club Iqp

data.Title: Boys And Girls Club Iqp
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report
data.Goal: To help students and families learn about digital citizenship and internet safety; to help students increase their Microsoft Office program skill sets
data.Stakeholders: Boys and Girls Club of Worcester
data.Impact: Understanding and awareness of digital citizenship and Microsoft Office programs were improved
data.Headline: Digital citizenship with the Boys & Girls Club

children.name: Developing A Steam Strategy For The Boys & Girls Club Of Worcester

data.Title: Developing A Steam Strategy For The Boys & Girls Club Of Worcester
data.Advisors: Jiusto, J. S. | Peet, R. Creighton
data.Notes: helps students at the boys and girls club; not just females
data.Goal: To help the Boys & Girls Club of Worcester implement a sustainable after-school STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Mathematics) program
data.Stakeholders: Boys & Girls Club of Worcester
data.Impact: Designed and piloted high yield learning activities using the Club’s new Lego Mindstorms kits and 3D printer
data.Headline: STEAM and the Boys & Girls Club

children.name: Extending The Impact Of Technovation On Armenian School Girls

data.Title: Extending The Impact Of Technovation On Armenian School Girls
data.Subject Terms: Engineering--study And Teaching | Women Engineers--education | Mobile Apps
data.Advisors: Ault, Holly K. | Aghajanian, Michael J.
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report, lots of graphics
data.Goal: To identify opportunities to motivate and support the girls to continue developing their personal, professional, and technical skills
data.Stakeholders: Schoolgirls in Armenia, stakeholders of Technovation Armenia, Women and Information Society NGO

children.name: Social Networking In First Robotics

data.Title: Social Networking In First Robotics
data.Goal: To look at the effects of social networking within FIRST Robotics
data.Stakeholders: Girls and boys involved in FIRST robotics, FIRST mentors
data.Impact: Females reported learning less in FIRST than males regardless of their prime; females had significantly lower self-efficacy than males regardless of their prime at the beginning of the season
data.Headline: Analyzing social networks in FIRST robotics
data.Follow-up: Follow up to see if problems have changed or are still the same

children.name: Developing Digital Literacy Modules For Women In Cuenca, Ecuador

data.Title: Developing Digital Literacy Modules For Women In Cuenca, Ecuador
data.Notes: Modules are presented in the appendices
data.Goal: To create a set of educational models that could be used to teach digital literacy workshops at Mujeres con Éxito in Cuenca, Ecuador
data.Stakeholders: Women at Mujeres con Éxito
data.Impact: Helped women that were victims of domestic abuse advance through teaching of computer literacy. Safety was heavily addressed when teaching internet and social media use
data.Headline: Digital literacy and victims of domestic abuse

children.name: Using Technology To Enhance Opportunities In A Disadvantaged Community Through Online Advocacy And Computer Education

data.Title: Using Technology To Enhance Opportunities In A Disadvantaged Community Through Online Advocacy And Computer Education
data.Subject Terms: Women--violence Against | Community Development | Science--study And Teaching
data.Notes: Uses technology to try to solve social issues
data.Goal: To develop a series of interactive advocacy videos to raise awareness of violence against women and the implement a computer science curriculum for the Community Centre
data.Stakeholders: Women and children in the area, Banskia Gardens Community Services
data.Impact: Demonstrated an underlying theme that technology can provide a valuable asset for Banksia Gardens Community Services. It is hoped that the efforts become an enabler to reduce family violence and help reduce unemployment in communities not only in Broadmeadows but other challenged communities worldwide
data.Headline: Using interactive media to prevent violence against women

children.name: Women's Empowerment Through Increasing Access And Understanding Of Technology

data.Title: Women's Empowerment Through Increasing Access And Understanding Of Technology
data.Subject Terms: Women--effect Of Technological Innovations On | Community Development | Teaching
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report
data.Goal: To empower members of Sizakuyenza’s Women’s Networking Group (WNG) by addressing this digital divide in the township of Philippi, Cape Town
data.Stakeholders: Sizakuyenza, women in Cape Town
data.Impact: Facilitated a pilot technology training programme, created an asset map of technology access points in local communities, developed a proposal to obtain funding for programme continuation and to establish a new technology access point at Sizakuyenza
data.Headline: Addressing the digital divide in Cape Town

children.name: Education at WPI
A Follow Up Study On The Class Of 1990?

data.Title: A Follow Up Study On The Class Of 1990?
data.Subject Terms: Women In Engineering | Personality And Intelligence
data.Notes: "Cognitive gender study"
data.Goal: Test the theory of gender and cognitive type as described in GCSI literature (people of a certain cognitive type have more/less success than in work force of different fields)
data.Stakeholders: WPI alumni
data.Impact: Due to problems with data management, no results were presented. Information was available from the class of 2002, and it was suggested that their information be kept up to date so they could be studied in the future
data.Headline: Gender and cognitive components of success

children.name: First Year Experience For Class Of 2003.

data.Title: First Year Experience For Class Of 2003.
data.Notes: Gender was just one component of the analysis
data.Goal: To assess the class of 2003 based on their GCSI and MBTI data and score them in groups to compare cognitive types
data.Stakeholders: WPI class of 2003, WPI
data.Impact: Answered questions about science and engineering; had two meetings a week- one was general and the other focused on a specific grade level. Was not committed to involving girls
data.Headline: Gender components of first year experience at WPI

children.name: Change In Academic Motivation At Wpi

data.Title: Change In Academic Motivation At Wpi
data.Goal: To explore motivation in education and examine its change in first year students at WPI
data.Stakeholders: WPI students and WPI as a whole
data.Impact: There was a weak relationship between gender and academic motivation, but there was a relationship between how students viewed faculty and their academic motivation
data.Headline: Gender related changes in academic motivation

children.name: Affects Of The Wpi Society On Students Over Time.

data.Title: Affects Of The Wpi Society On Students Over Time.
data.Subject Terms: Women In Engineering |women Engineers--education | Women--social Conditions
data.Notes: More of a research study- no recommendations presented
data.Goal: To give information about the flaws in the WPI society that can be fixed; identify major changes students go through and, by comparing to changes at Assumption College, identify problem areas
data.Stakeholders: Students at WPI and Assumption college
data.Impact: Developed and tested a series of workshops for WPI Camp REACH alumni- helps retain interest in STEM
data.Headline: Negative perceptions? Social pressures of female WPI students

children.name: Social Programming At Worcester Polytechnic Institute

data.Title: Social Programming At Worcester Polytechnic Institute
data.Subject Terms: Women--violence Against| Education, Higher | Community Development | Mental Health
data.Notes: Gender was just one component of the analysis
data.Goal: To improve the understanding of student life at WPI and identify the needs of the students
data.Stakeholders: WPI, WPI students, Student Government Association (SGA)
data.Impact: Found that a large percentage of students aren't socially confident in themselves
data.Headline: Programming to improve mental and social well-being of WPI students

children.name: Acute And Chronic Stressor Mechanisms In Health Disparities

data.Title: Acute And Chronic Stressor Mechanisms In Health Disparities
data.Subject Terms: Women In Engineering | Women In Science | Women--social Conditions | Equality--social Aspects | Mental Health
data.Notes: Focused mainly on racial microaggressions, but related them to gender
data.Goal: To evaluate the impact and frequency of microaggressions
data.Stakeholders: Minority groups (women, racial minorities)
data.Impact: Revealed the state of microaggressions at WPI- females self-reported the most microaggressions and daily discrimination. Seniors experienced the most microaggressions, and people of a perceived higher social standing did not have a strong response to microaggressions.
data.Headline: gender and racial microaggressions at WPI?

children.name: An Investigation Of Linguistic Complexity By Sex And Minority Status Under Stress

data.Title: An Investigation Of Linguistic Complexity By Sex And Minority Status Under Stress
data.Goal: To determine if the speech between men, women, and minorities is different under stress; to determine if these differences are found between speaking and self-reported experiences
data.Stakeholders: WPI students
data.Impact: Content words- females higher in categories of friend, female, sexual, archive, and reward; males higher in clout and words per second
data.Headline: How stress affects speech between women, men, and minorities

children.name: An Analysis Of The Effectiveness Of Bridging Of Fundamental Courses In The First Year

data.Title: An Analysis Of The Effectiveness Of Bridging Of Fundamental Courses In The First Year
data.Subject Terms: Science--study And Teaching | Project Method In Teaching
data.Advisors: Miller, Judith E. | Goulet, John A.
data.Notes: More focused on students overall, but did mention some results by gender
data.Goal: To assess the effectiveness of the "bridging model" based on students' performance in courses and change in students' attitudes towards engineering and science
data.Stakeholders: WPI students, WPI professors
data.Impact: The survey results demonstrated increases in bridged students' self-confidence in their problem solving abilities, and basic engineering knowledge and skills
data.Headline: Gender components of the bridging model

children.name: Six Degrees Of Wpi

data.Title: Six Degrees Of Wpi
data.Advisors: Fisler, Kathryn | Selkow, Stanley | Schull, Jon
data.Notes: Project tried to examination correlation between gender and amount of emails sent, but there was no relation
data.Goal: To examine the properties of social networks in the WPI community and attempts to provide answers or more information on issues that are important to providing for such a network at the WPI community
data.Stakeholders: Students and faculty/staff at WPI
data.Impact: No correlation was found between the amount of emails and gender ratios
data.Headline: Social networks at WPI

children.name: The Effect Of Instructor Gender And Student Gender On Course Evaluations

data.Title: The Effect Of Instructor Gender And Student Gender On Course Evaluations
data.Notes: Very outdated recommendations- show the double standard of women in the workplace
data.Goal: To determine the effects of instructor gender and student gender on student evaluations of the professors at Worcester Polytechnic Institute
data.Stakeholders: WPI professors
data.Impact: The results seemed to show that female professors received lower ratings than male professors and female professors receive their highest ratings from female students and their lowest ratings from male students- but sample size was too small to draw a definite conclusion
data.Headline: The effect of instructor and student gender on course evaluations

children.name: Coeducational Living In On-campus Suites And Apartments.

data.Title: Coeducational Living In On-campus Suites And Apartments.
data.Goal: To argue that coeducational housing on-campus should be an option for interested students
data.Stakeholders: WPI students
data.Impact: Women seemed to favor co-ed housing as lower stress than living with all females
data.Headline: Coed living at WPI

children.name: Alternate Reality Game For Wpi Admissions.

data.Title: Alternate Reality Game For Wpi Admissions.
data.Notes: Abstract mentions boosting number of women enrolling at WPI, but no specific data is mentioned in the paper
data.Goal: Create a successful and fun alternate reality game; help WPI Admissions increase number of admitted students who decide to attend WPI; bring attention to IMGD program
data.Stakeholders: WPI Admissions, students admitted to WPI class of 2011
data.Impact: The game was not very successful as a marketing tool (only 500 visitors to the site)- more marketing should be done in order to obtain more visitors. The goal mentioned increasing the number of females at WPI, but did not present any specific data on this.
data.Headline: Attracting female students to WPI through AR games

children.name: Attracting And Retaining Women In Ece.

data.Title: Attracting And Retaining Women In Ece.
data.Goal: Examine underrepresentation of women in ECE and why it is a problem; determine if changing or creating the department’s marketing strategies will have a positive impact on women who choose ECE as a major
data.Stakeholders: ECE students, ECE department, WPI as an organization
data.Impact: In order to increase the number of females enrolled in ECE, tour guides should convey general information when outside Atwater Kent, information packages targeted at young women should be developed, undeclared majors should be assigned academic advisors in ECE, and the number of ECE faculty should be increased
data.Headline: Gender components of ECE education at WPI
data.Follow-up: Might be interesting to redo and see if the type of problem has changed

children.name: Computer Science Experience At Wpi

data.Title: Computer Science Experience At Wpi
data.Subject Terms: Science--study And Teaching | Women In Science | Education, Higher
data.Notes: Not specifically focused on women, but does mention results by gender
data.Goal: To determine how demographic, experience, and confidence affects computer science students at WPI
data.Stakeholders: Students at WPI- mainly computer science students, but also related majors
data.Impact: Males had more confidence than females overall- especially prior to college
data.Headline: Gender components of CS education at WPI

children.name: Attraction And Retention Of Women In Computer Science At Worcester Polytechnic Institute

data.Title: Attraction And Retention Of Women In Computer Science At Worcester Polytechnic Institute
data.Goal: To help the Computer Science Department at Worcester Polytechnic Institute understand the underlying reasons why female students are underrepresented in the department
data.Stakeholders: CS students, CS faculty, CS department
data.Impact: Gave recommendations for CS students, faculty, and department in order to increase student-student and student-faculty interactions, increase number of work areas for students, and increase academic advisors' connects with students
data.Headline: Gender components of CS education at WPI

children.name: Health
Athletics
Health And Technology In Rowing: A Healthier Process Of Making Weight For The Lightweight Rower

data.Title: Health And Technology In Rowing: A Healthier Process Of Making Weight For The Lightweight Rower
data.Goal: To understand the issues surrounding weight loss in rowing and suggest recommendations for making weight healthier for lightweight athletes
data.Stakeholders: Women on college rowing teams, coaches of rowing teams
data.Impact: Found that women on college rowing teams were more concerned with making weight than the health effects of it; many athletes did not know about long term health risks of making weight
data.Headline: Health risks of making weight in rowing

children.name: Health And Technology In Rowing -- An Assessment Of Coaches' Knowledge Of The Healthy Limits Of Women.

data.Title: Health And Technology In Rowing -- An Assessment Of Coaches' Knowledge Of The Healthy Limits Of Women.
data.Goal: To determine whether or not coaches have realistic opinions about the limits of a woman’s body in the context of becoming a lightweight rower
data.Stakeholders: Coaches of lightweight women, lightweight women rowers
data.Impact: Revealed that coaches often thought other lightweight rowers were too thin, but did not as often consider this about their own athletes
data.Headline: Coaches' perceptions of making weight in rowing

children.name: Human Interactions And Decision-making In Recreational Avalanche Environments

data.Title: Human Interactions And Decision-making In Recreational Avalanche Environments
data.Notes: Speculations about why women might be involved in less avalanche-related deaths, but nothing concrete
data.Goal: To help reduce the number of avalanche deaths by studying the decision-making processes of individuals recreating in alpine environments
data.Stakeholders: Skiers
data.Impact: Women are less likely to die in avalanches while participating in alpine recreation
data.Headline: Gender related components of avalanche related deaths

children.name: Domestic Violence
Enhancing The Mentor Network At Voces Vitales Costa Rica

data.Title: Enhancing The Mentor Network At Voces Vitales Costa Rica
data.Advisors: Madan, Aarti S.| Madan, Ryan S.
data.Notes: Vital Voices helps women who are victims of domestic abuse
data.Goal: To understand and evaluate the preexisting mentor network and analyze the best practices for networking for Vital Voices
data.Stakeholders: Voces Vitales (VVCR), mentors at VVCR
data.Impact: Recommendations were made to help develop the mentor network at VVCR
data.Headline: Mentor networks for domestic violence victims in Costa Rica

children.name: Helping Vital Voices Impact More Women: Developing An Online Mentoring Platform

data.Title: Helping Vital Voices Impact More Women: Developing An Online Mentoring Platform
data.Advisors: Chiarelli, James A.| McCauley, Stephen M.
data.Notes: Website screenshots: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1lXF0LUAUBUf3O5vIsooryPiaWNUr8BtH
data.Goal: To help Vital Voices Costa Rica (VVCR) impact more women
data.Stakeholders: Voces Vitales and the women they work with
data.Impact: Created mockups for web platforms and an implementation guide for Voces Vitales so they could have a better mentor network
data.Headline: Online mentoring for domestic violence victims in Costa Rica

children.name: Permaculture Design Plan For María Amor Foundation, Cuenca Ecuador

data.Title: Permaculture Design Plan For María Amor Foundation, Cuenca Ecuador
data.Notes: The María Amor foundation is a women's shelter for domestic abuse victims. Additional media located at: https://web.wpi.edu/Pubs/E-project/Available/E-project-121218-181752/unrestricted/Master_Plan.pdf and https://web.wpi.edu/Pubs/E-project/Available/E-project-121218-181752/unrestricted/Deliverable.pdf
data.Goal: To design an integrated land-use plan to provide food for internal use as well as to sell
data.Stakeholders: Women and their children who are victims of domestic abuse
data.Impact: Developed a landscape design that includes values of permaculture to create the most practical land use plan for the María Amor foundation; also takes into account existing landscape features and buildings to layout an achievable, sustainable and functional farm
data.Headline: Permaculture for DV victims in Cuenca, Ecuador

children.name: Preventing Violence Against Women: Training Resources To Empower The Broadmeadows Community

data.Title: Preventing Violence Against Women: Training Resources To Empower The Broadmeadows Community
data.Advisors: Ault, Holly K.| Hanlan, James P.
data.Goal: To create and develop training resources to educate and empower the community to prevent violence against women
data.Stakeholders: Banskia Gardens Community Services, members of the Broadmeadows community
data.Impact: Findings were used to develop Good People Act Now training resources and design the Good Children Act Now program to help stop violence against women
data.Headline: Training resources to prevent DV in Australia

children.name: Violence Against Women: Using Interactive Performance To Inspire Change

data.Title: Violence Against Women: Using Interactive Performance To Inspire Change
data.Subject Terms: Women--violence Against | Community Development | Websites--design And Construction
data.Advisors: Higgins, Lorraine D.| Ottmar, Erin R.
data.Notes: Visually pleasing report
data.Goal: To assist GPAN (Good People Act Now) in its violence prevention work, particularly cyber abuse against women
data.Stakeholders: GPAN, women in the area
data.Impact: Raised awareness about abuse of women by targeting youth; also produced infographics and pamphlets and updated the GPAN website
data.Headline: Preventing cyber abuse against women in Australia

children.name: Homelessness
Fund Raising Methods

data.Title: Fund Raising Methods
data.Goal: Study women’s issues such as drug abuse, homelessness, domestic abuse, and poverty; recommend new approach and help fundraise for women at Abby’s House
data.Stakeholders: Abby’s House, women at Abby’s House
data.Impact: Evaluated different methods of fundraising and found that asking for help from large companies was the most effective
data.Headline: Fundraising methods for Abby's House

children.name: Fundraising For Homeless Women And Children

data.Title: Fundraising For Homeless Women And Children
data.Goal: To understand homelessness, to collect monetary aid and essential goods for Abby's House, to raise awareness in the WPI community about homelessness
data.Stakeholders: Abby’s House, women at Abby’s House, people in the WPI community
data.Impact: Found that fundraising could be improved by more advertising, longer fundraising periods, and expanding the audience
data.Headline: Fundraising methods for Abby's House

children.name: No Sub-Category
Internet Abuse In The Workplace.

data.Title: Internet Abuse In The Workplace.
data.Goal: The purpose and focus of this study is to research more effective means of managing the internet in the workplace to prevent employee abuse while being aware of the ethical and professional responsibilities of the employer
data.Stakeholders: Employees and employers
data.Impact: Found that there is an obvious need for enhanced management techniques that not only detect and report Internet abuse but aid in preventing it as well
data.Headline: Preventing internet abuse in the workplace

children.name: Mitigating Noxious Gases Produced By Traditional Cooking Methods

data.Title: Mitigating Noxious Gases Produced By Traditional Cooking Methods
data.Advisors: McCauley, Stephen M.| Shockey, Ingrid K.
data.Notes: This project specifically affects women because of the cooking they do using the stoves; report is visually pleasing
data.Goal: To mitigate the gas production caused by this fuel and to alleviate the negative health effects
data.Stakeholders: Rural village residents in Himachal Pradesh
data.Impact: Traditional stoves cause exposure to noxious gases- new prototype developed should prevent this. Women were impacted because they do most of the cooking
data.Headline: Prototyping stoves to prevent noxious gases

children.name: The Zimri Project: Running Water And Bathroom Facilities For A Rural Moroccan School

data.Title: The Zimri Project: Running Water And Bathroom Facilities For A Rural Moroccan School
data.Subject Terms: Women--social Conditions | Community Development | Women--effect Of Technological Innovations On
data.Notes: No direct connection could be drawn between having private bathroom facilities and increasing the number of girls enrolled at schools, but that was the hope for developing the recommendations for the private bathroom
data.Goal: To develop a plan for bringing running water to a school in Zimri, Morocco and for building an enclosed bathroom facility
data.Stakeholders: Schoolchildren in Zimri
data.Impact: The findings from the research pointed to the conclusion that a solar powered pumping system along with a compost toilet would work best for the conditions of the Zimri village. The hope is that having an enclosed bathroom facility would allow girls to come to school again
data.Headline: Water in schools to encourage girls' education in Morocco
data.Follow-up: See if long term plans were put into place- if not, see how it could be facilitated

children.name: Recommendations To Improve Quality Of Life At The Pakkred Home

data.Title: Recommendations To Improve Quality Of Life At The Pakkred Home
data.Notes: Lots of visuals in the report
data.Goal: To identify needs for improvement, generate a prioritized list of these needs, and develop recommendations for improvement at Pakkred Home
data.Stakeholders: International Support Group, Pakkred Home, girls in Pakkred Home
data.Impact: Developed a lengthy list of recommendations to improve quality of life, including repairing toilets and the water distribution system
data.Headline: Improving quality of life at a girls home

children.name: Talking About Food: Improving Communication Between Ghanaian Women And Medical Practitioners

data.Title: Talking About Food: Improving Communication Between Ghanaian Women And Medical Practitioners
data.Goal: To address communication barriers between medical practitioners and Ghanaian women on issues related to nutrition, food preparation, and the role of food in Ghanaian culture, by producing educational videos targeted at medical practitioners
data.Stakeholders: Ghanian patients and medical practitioners
data.Impact: Produced videos to help improve communication between medical practitioners and the Ghanaian community about nutrition, food choices, and the cultural aspect of eating
data.Headline: Bettering nutrition for Ghanian women

children.name: Reproductive
Social And Technological Aspects Of Ru486.

data.Title: Social And Technological Aspects Of Ru486.
data.Goal: To develop an educational web page with info about RU486 and other abortion techniques (including procedural) and the pros and cons of each technique
data.Stakeholders: Women
data.Impact: Listed three main issues to the abortion debate: status of the embryo, how to access facts surrounding the issue, and the debate about abortion is actually a debate about the role of a person
data.Headline: Social and technological aspects of abortion

children.name: Exploring Intravaginal Ring Acceptability For Disease Prevention Among At-risk Community Members In Cape Town

data.Title: Exploring Intravaginal Ring Acceptability For Disease Prevention Among At-risk Community Members In Cape Town
data.Notes: The report itself is visually pleasing, and there is a good infographic in the appendix
data.Goal: To explore IVR acceptability and accessibility preferences within at-risk populations outside of the context of a clinical trial in order to assess promoters and barriers to product adherence that may ultimately affect product efficacy
data.Stakeholders: Sizakuyenza, at-risk men and women in Cape Town
data.Impact: Found that women had limited use of intravaginal products (such as tampons), which might present difficulties when inserting the IVR; both men and women would appreciate the additional protection; and misuse and stigmatization surrounds IVRs
data.Headline: Exploring IVR acceptability in Cape Town
data.Follow-up: Follow up to determine if stigmas have changed

children.name: Supporting Breastfeeding Mothers At Work And At Home In Indonesia

data.Title: Supporting Breastfeeding Mothers At Work And At Home In Indonesia
data.Goal: To understand the challenges that women working in factories in Indonesia face in providing breastmilk to their infants
data.Stakeholders: Babies in Common, breastfeeding mothers in Indonesia
data.Impact: Found that that there was a need for greater educational and policy support at the home, work, and community level for breastfeeding
data.Headline: Supporting breastfeeding mothers in Indonesia

children.name: Women's Cancers
A Study Of Patient Treatment Scheduling At The Gillette Center For Women's Cancers.

data.Title: A Study Of Patient Treatment Scheduling At The Gillette Center For Women's Cancers.
data.Goal: Sought to determine requirements for treatment calendars and the problems associated with this creation process
data.Stakeholders: Patients and research coordinators at Gillette Center for Women’s cancers
data.Impact: Recommendations were made for a treatment calendar system and software; recommended system was low cost and had to ability to create and save multiple calendars
data.Headline: Treatment schedules for Gillette Center for Women's Cancers

children.name: Breast Cancer In Thailand: Developing Effective And Accessible Media On Integrative Therapies For Breast Cancer Patients

data.Title: Breast Cancer In Thailand: Developing Effective And Accessible Media On Integrative Therapies For Breast Cancer Patients
data.Goal: To develop media in the form of a DVD that will educate and inform breast cancer patients about integrative therapies
data.Stakeholders: Bangkok Breast Cancer Support Group, Queen Sikrit Centre for Breast Cancer, breast cancer patients in Thailand
data.Impact: Created a DVD with nine chapters that introduced yoga and meditation with discussion of their benefits, discussed survivor stories and their experiences with integrative therapies, and provided demonstrations for using yoga and meditation
data.Headline: Interactive media for breast cancer patients

children.name: Breast Cancer Information In The Media.

data.Title: Breast Cancer Information In The Media.
data.Goal: To explore the manner in which young women viewed breast cancer information presented by a magazine and a scientific journal; to determine whether women with different educational background would respond differently to these two types of articles
data.Stakeholders: Female students at WPI and Becker College
data.Impact: Found that the response to two different sources was due to more than just the affiliated school (e.g. scientific literacy, reading abilities, etc.)
data.Headline: Breast cancer information in the media

children.name: Promoting Awareness And Early Detection Of Breast Cancer In Thailand

data.Title: Promoting Awareness And Early Detection Of Breast Cancer In Thailand
data.Goal: To assist the Bangkok Breast Cancer Support Group and the Queen Sirikit Centre for Breast Cancer develop a brochure, catalogue, and website that provides accurate, accessible, and up-to-date information on breast cancer, as well as to determine strategies for the BBCs and the Centre to further expand the current awareness of breast cancer and breast cancer treatment in Thailand
data.Stakeholders: Bangkok Breast Cancer Support Group, Queen Sirikit Centre for Breast Cancer, breast cancer patients in Thailand
data.Impact: There is a communication gap between Thai medical professionals and the general Thai public about breast cancer and the brochure, catalogue, and website that were developed are potential means for the Queen Sirikit Centre for Breast Cancer and Bangkok Breast Cancer Support Group to mend the communication gap

children.name: Supporting The Fight Against Cancer In Morocco: Database Implementation And Data Management For Association Jannat

data.Title: Supporting The Fight Against Cancer In Morocco: Database Implementation And Data Management For Association Jannat
data.Subject Terms: Electronic Data Processing | Public Health | Women--health
data.Notes: Lots of visuals in the report
data.Goal: To enhance the data management of Association Jannat through the creation and implementation of a database
data.Stakeholders: Association Jannat, patients with Association Jannat
data.Impact: Created a database to streamline data management, which decreased the amount of time and energy staff dedicated towards administrative duties, allowing them to focus on caring for patients; this database also allows the association to present summary statistics about their operations to potential donors and the media

children.name: Other
No Sub-Category
Science Museum -- Creating The Morphing Image Database.

data.Title: Science Museum -- Creating The Morphing Image Database.
data.Advisors: Ault, Holly K. | Brattin, Joel J.
data.Notes: Gender was just one component of the analysis
data.Goal: To develop and implement a strategy to create an image database that would be compatible with the morphing interactives
data.Stakeholders: London Science Museum, museum visitors
data.Impact: Created strong average images that produced impressive morphs during testing

children.name: Walk Newton: A Study Of Pedestrian Mobility In Newton, Ma

data.Title: Walk Newton: A Study Of Pedestrian Mobility In Newton, Ma
data.Notes: one of the sponsors was a women's organization
data.Goal: to recommend improvements for greater pedestrian mobility in four of Newton’s villages
data.Stakeholders: Newton’s Planning and Development Department, League of Women Voters, community of Newton
data.Impact: Identified challenges facing mobility and the opportunities for increasing mobility in each area by assessing conditions, observing pedestrians, and interviewing residents

children.name: Evaluating The Effects Of Camp Reach On The Middle School Teachers

data.Title: Evaluating The Effects Of Camp Reach On The Middle School Teachers
data.Notes: Camp Reach is a program for middle school girls to participate in STEM
data.Goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of Camp Reach as a professional development program
data.Stakeholders: Middle school teachers, Camp REACH
data.Impact: Results showed that teachers’ knowledge of engineering and classroom usage of engineering increased, and led to the recommendation that the MSTs be provided with a lesson plan that can be utilized directly in their classrooms based off certain camp activities

children.name: Gender Neutral Bathrooms

data.Title: Gender Neutral Bathrooms
data.Notes: report discusses making bathrooms more accessible to anyone outside gender binary
data.Goal: To implement gender neutral bathrooms at WPI
data.Stakeholders: WPI, WPI students, students who use gender neutral bathrooms
data.Impact: The survey results indicated that conversion of some single stall gender specific bathrooms on our campus to gender neutral bathrooms would be acceptable to our general community, and would improve bathroom experiences for those who indicated a preference for gender neutral bathrooms

children.name: A Future Scientists And Engineers Club For Doherty Hs -- A Pilot Project

data.Title: A Future Scientists And Engineers Club For Doherty Hs -- A Pilot Project
data.Subject Terms: Engineering--study And Teaching |science--study And Teaching | Women In Engineering
data.Notes: Only mentioned girls in passing
data.Goal: Ultimate goal is to help high school students achieve career aspirations
data.Stakeholders: Students at Doherty Memorial High School, Worcester City Manager’s Advisory Committee on the Status of Women (ACSW)
data.Impact: Answered questions about science and engineering; had two meetings a week- one was general and the other focused on a specific grade level. Was not committed to involving girls
